item.description:
Go back in time to Robin Hood’s Springtime Festival History Repeats Itself

May 21 - 2011 (Rain or Shine) 11:00 am to 7:00 pm 

http://www.ctfaire.com/spring/

www.ctfaire.com/spring/

Hours & Directions link Includes a diagram of the Fair Grounds.

 http://www.guilfordfair.org/hours_directions.htm

www.guilfordfair.org/hours_directions.htm

Facebook:

http://www.facebook.com/ctfaire

www.facebook.com/ctfaire

Guilford Fair Grounds Lovers Lane Guilford, CT 06437 (203) 453-3543

http://www.guilfordfair.org/

www.guilfordfair.org/

Attendance Fee is General Admission (13+): $15*

Youth Admission (5-12): $8*

Child Admission (5 and under): $ FREE

http://www.ctfaire.com/spring/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=32&Itemid=56

www.ctfaire.com/spring/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=32&Itemid=56

 

Other Connecticut Faire later in the year is;

Hebron Renaissance Fair http://www.ctfaire.com/fall/

www.ctfaire.com/fall/

http://culturemob.com/events/5879808-connecticut-renaissance-faire-ct-hebron-hebron-ct-venue

culturemob.com/events/5879808-connecticut-renaissance-faire-ct-hebron-hebron-ct-venue

We will have a Meet Up going here in 2011.

I have not yet decided what day to go.

Probably make that Decision around late August to early September.

@ Renaissance Magazine can be found in Barnes and Noble, as well as some other book stores.

Renaissance Magazine http://www.renaissancemagazine.com/

www.renaissancemagazine.com/

Costumes are not needed to attend the Renaissance Faire.

Comfortable clothes for walking around and your sense of humor

Are what is best to bring.

Mike B.

Organizer
item.how_to_find_us: I will have my purple back pack.
